docs.snippet: Not long ago, I passed through the Loeb Student Center, at New York University's Washington Square campus. It is a modern and luxurious building to my eyes, definitely "posh" with comfortable sofas and chairs, ample space and light and all those l...
docs.lead_paragraph: Not long ago, I passed through the Loeb Student Center, at New York University's Washington Square campus. It is a modern and luxurious building to my eyes, definitely "posh" with comfortable sofas and chairs, ample space and light and all those little amenities that correspond to our middle-class notions of "gracious living."
docs.abstract: Irving Kristol article on student radicals at NYU during 30's; describes his experiences as member of Young People's Socialist League (Fourth Internatl), commonly designated as Trotskyist; illus (L)
